intro: Pimpinella schatilensis, commonly known as the Schatil's cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, fern-like appearance. Pimpinella schatilensis is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
